meanings.definition: The state or quality of being misty.
meanings.sent1: The mistinesses of the morning made everything look dreamy.
meanings.sent2: The mistinesses in the forest created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The mistinesses in the air made it hard to see where the path led.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were shrouded in mistinesses, making it hard to recall clearly.
meanings.sent5: The mistinesses of the lake at dawn were like a soft blanket over the water.

meanings.definition: The presence of mist or fog.
meanings.sent1: We couldn't see far due to the mistinesses enveloping the valley.
meanings.sent2: The mistinesses on the mountain obscured the view of the town below.
meanings.sent3: The mistinesses rolled in unexpectedly, causing a sense of mystery and wonder.
meanings.sent4: The mistinesses hung low, like a veil hiding the secrets of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The mistinesses of the sea at dusk painted a serene picture of nature.

meanings.definition: Lack of clarity or sharpness in visual perception.
meanings.sent1: The mistinesses in his vision made it hard to read the signs.
meanings.sent2: She rubbed her eyes to clear the mistinesses clouding her sight.
meanings.sent3: The mistinesses in the mirror made her reflection appear blurry and distorted.
meanings.sent4: The mistinesses of the old photograph added a nostalgic touch to the memory.
meanings.sent5: The mistinesses of the window glass made the world outside seem like a painting.
